title: Dayton, Ky. residents react after body found in vacant home
content:
The body found inside a vacant Dayton, Kentucky, home likely was inside the house a matter of months, rather than years, according to investigators. 
 
Dayton Police Chief David Halfhill will only say the body was found in a position “difficult to get into.” 

Watch this story 

“Very creepy,” said Heather Slone, who lives directly behind the home. “It’s scary. It really is, I mean, who would think something like that would have happened.” 

Slone has another reason this is all more eerie for her. “I lived there for a few years when I was a teenager,” she said. 

Slone said she lived in the home with her mother and brother about a decade ago. 

“Where it all happened in the basement was the workshop. My brother, all of his friends, it was a hangout spot,” Slone said. 

The body was discovered Saturday after detectives, working on an unrelated case, were told they should search the home at 121 6th Street. 

There is still no identification on the body or even if the person was a man or a woman. 

Detectives are looking through missing person reports to see if there are any clues that could provide help in solving the mystery.
